result.execSummary:
The defendant Rafael Eleazar Cagsanon Balam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).
  • Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).
  • Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: **AMENDMENT 12-05-2016 - IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the Defendant has a total of Three-Hundred and Seventeen (317) of dead time credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $405,706.20 and restitution surcharge. Restitution is held open 60 days.
--------------------------------

Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision fees.  If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
--------------------------------

Not to possess or consume alcohol. Not to possess controlled substance or drug paraphernalia. Any prescription medications to be made known to Agent and taken as prescribed.
--------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  TAD at Agent's discretion. Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
--------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
--------------------------------

records.addlTxt: Temporary Commitment form filed

1:40 pm  Defendant Rafael Eleazar Cagsanon Balam in court, in custody with attorney Christopher Lyle Kuehn.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Christopher Duesing in court on behalf of three minor victims, P.C.O., E.V.O. and A.C.O., whom he represents in  civil matter.  Victims are present with their parents/guardians.
Interpreter Liesl Monroy sworn and interprets for parents/guardians of minor victims.
Victims C.S.O.G, A.A. and G.A. in court.
Court has reviewed PSI and Risk Assessment as well as Victim Impact Statements and BIFs submitted by both sides.  Court takes short recess to review Victim Impact Statement submitted in court by victim A.A.
Court takes another short recess to allow both sides to review Risk Assessment.
2:15 pm  Victim C.S.O.G. makes a statement to Court. 
2:18 pm  ADA Donohoo makes record of limited agreement.
2:20 pm  Sentencing argument and recommendation by ADA Donohoo.
2:36 pm  Sentencing argument and recommendation by Attorney Kuehn.
2:47 pm  Defendant makes statement to Court.
2:50 pm  Court pronounces sentences as follows:

Ct 1 - 3 years IC followed by 3 years ES
Ct 3 - 3 years IC followed by 3 years ES, concurrent to Ct 1
Ct 5 - 3 years IC followed by 3 years ES, concurrent to Cts 1 and 3
Ct 11 -11.5 years probation, consecutive to Cts 1, 3 and 5
Ct 12 - 11.5 years probation, concurrent to Ct 11 but consecutive to Cts 1, 3 and 5

Conditions of Extended Supervision/Probation:

Costs on each count including supervision fees
Restitution in the amount of $405,706.20 and surcharges, held open 60 days
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge
Not to possess or consume alcohol
Not to possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
Any prescription meds to be made known to Agent and taken as prescribed
AODA and follow-through
Counseling as recommended by Agent
Obtain and maintain stable employment
TAD at Agent's discretion
2 years revocation of DL
2 year installation of IID

Court goes over felony prohibitions including, ineligibility to vote or possess a firearm.
Copy of WEDS form given to defendant.
Risk Assessment

Defendant Rafael Eleazar Cagsanon Balam in court, in custody with attorney Christopher Lyle Kuehn.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Defendant in court in custody with attorney Julia May. Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH P.C. 9-10-2003, E.V. 6-1-2001, A.C. 7-1-2000.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
